q: : GOP relieved I'm gone Mike Pence Steele, the newly ousted chairman of the Republican National Committee, said he's "disappointed" he lost the recent election but that many in his party are relieved. I think the people in the party, particularly the establishment, are breathing a sigh of relief, Steele said Wednesday on CNN's "The Situation Room." "They have control of the RNC now; let's see what they do with it." Steele said he thinks members of his party wanted

Howard Stern calls for Hollywood to boycott Jay Leno ( video) Howard Stern ended his third and final segment on Thursday night's Late Show once again pushing for David Letterman to holler back at him off camera: "Maybe we'll get our relationship on track. I want to say this. I offered my apology and it's sincere. If you trust that I'm somewhat normal now, what we'll do is we'll start by calling each other and then maybe I'll come out to Montana and I'll stare at the wall with you and we'll see what happens. " Hmm,... what would the Iron Sheik have to say about this? Follow the Howard Stern Examiner on Twitter and Facebook Want email updates on Howard Stern ? Subscribe

after a shot-clock violation on Philadelphia with 4.9 seconds left. Sarunas Jasikevicius threw an inbound pass to Paul George , who went around a stumbling Kyle Korver to make an uncontested shot. "I was 0-for-infinity," Paul George said. I just wanted to make a shot. We knew they'd switch. I went backdoor and got to the basket. My teammates showed confidence in me to give me the ball. It seemed like I hadn't made a shot all game. Paul George missed 15 of his first 19 shots before the easy layup. , in filing suit Monday( Jan. 31). The scheduled speaker for the annual National Prayer Luncheon on Feb. 10 is Lt. Clebe McClary, a decorated disabled Vietnam veteran from South Carolina. By making a fundamentalist Christian the keynote speaker at this event, the government has promoted, elevated, endorsed and favored Christianity over all other religions, they argued. Academy spokesman Lt. Col. John Bryan said McClary was invited after former Secretary of State Colin Powell could not attend. early peeks in The Washington Post and The New York Times at former Defense Donald Rumsfeld 's memoir, which goes on sale next week. A few highlights from the Post's report:- Donald Rumsfeld goes so far as to depict former President Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq. - " Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. people give him credit for." Though Dermot O'Leary admits he enjoys working with Simon Cowell , he and the rest of the people who work with the music mogul hate to let him down. He added: Don't get me wrong, he's still my boss, but he's sort of a Victorian father- you'd hate to let him down. On the occasion that happens I literally feel sick.
